com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface GenericMsg

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Msg, XMLDecoder

    public interface GenericMsg
extends Msg
    A bi-directional UPA message that does not have any implicit interaction semantics associated with it, thus the name generic. Once a stream is established via a request-refresh/status interaction, this message can be sent from consumer to provider as well as from provider to consumer, and can also be leveraged by non-interactive provider applications. Generic messages are transient and are typically not cached by any Enterprise Platform components. The msgKey of a GenericMsg does not need to match the MsgKey information associated with the stream the generic message is flowing on. This allows for the key information to be used independently of the stream. Any specific message usage, msgKey usage, expected interactions, and handling instructions are typically defined by a domain message model specification.
    See Also:
    Msg, GenericMsgFlags

      • partNum

        void partNum(int partNum)
        Specifies the part number of this generic message, typically used with multi-part generic messages. If sent on a single-part post message, use a partNum of 0. On multi-part post messages, use a partNum of 0 on the initial part and increment partNum in each subsequent part by 1.
        Parameters:
        partNum - the partNum to set

      • partNum

        int partNum()
        Specifies the part number of this generic message, typically used with multi-part generic messages. If sent on a single-part post message, use a partNum of 0. On multi-part post messages, use a partNum of 0 on the initial part and increment partNum in each subsequent part by 1.
        Returns:
        the partNum

      • seqNum

        void seqNum(long seqNum)
        Specifies a user-defined sequence number and typically corresponds to the sequencing of this message. To help with temporal ordering, seqNum should increase across messages, but can have gaps depending on the sequencing algorithm in use. Details about using seqNum should be defined in the domain model specification or the documentation for products which require the use of seqNum.
        Parameters:
        seqNum - the seqNum to set. Valid range is 0-4294967296 (2^32).

      • seqNum

        long seqNum()
        Specifies a user-defined sequence number and typically corresponds to the sequencing of this message. To help with temporal ordering, seqNum should increase across messages, but can have gaps depending on the sequencing algorithm in use. Details about using seqNum should be defined in the domain model specification or the documentation for products which require the use of seqNum.
        Returns:
        the seqNum

      • secondarySeqNum

        void secondarySeqNum(long secondarySeqNum)
        Specifies an additional user-defined sequence number. When using GenericMsg on a stream in a bi-directional manner, secondarySeqNum is often used as an acknowledgment sequence number. For example, a consumer sends a generic message with seqNum populated to indicate the sequence of this message in the stream and secondarySeqNum set to the seqNum last received from the provider. This effectively acknowledges all messages received up to that point while also sending additional information. Sequence number use should be defined within the domain model specification or any documentation for products that use secondarySeqNum.
        Parameters:
        secondarySeqNum - the secondarySeqNum to set. Valid range is 0-4294967296 (2^32).

      • secondarySeqNum

        long secondarySeqNum()
        Specifies an additional user-defined sequence number. When using GenericMsg on a stream in a bi-directional manner, secondarySeqNum is often used as an acknowledgment sequence number. For example, a consumer sends a generic message with seqNum populated to indicate the sequence of this message in the stream and secondarySeqNum set to the seqNum last received from the provider. This effectively acknowledges all messages received up to that point while also sending additional information. Sequence number use should be defined within the domain model specification or any documentation for products that use secondarySeqNum.
        Returns:
        the secondarySeqNum

      • permData

        void permData(Buffer permData)
        Specifies authorization information for this stream. When permData is specified, it indicates authorization information for only the content within this message, though this can be overridden for specific content within the message (for example, MapEntry.permData).
        Parameters:
        permData - the permData to set

      • permData

        Buffer permData()
        Specifies authorization information for this stream. When permData is specified, it indicates authorization information for only the content within this message, though this can be overridden for specific content within the message (for example, MapEntry.permData).
        Returns:
        the permData
